title: 1,    :(    2,   :I    3,   :J    4,   :)     5. ;)
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"How many distinct four-digit numbers can be formed using only the digits 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5? Assume also that no digit may be used more than once?"}]}]}

title: 12 Islanders Puzzle (From Brooklyn 99)
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"There are twelve identical looking islanders and a seesaw. One of the islanders weighs slightly more or less then the other 11, and you must find out which. What is the least amount of times you can use the seesaw to solve this problem?"}]}]}

title: Vertical oscillations
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Vertical displacement of a plank with a body of mass "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"m"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" on it is varying according to the law "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y= \sin{\omega t} + \sqrt{3}\cos{\omega t}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". The minimum value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\omega"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" such that the mass breaks  off the plank and the moment it occur first after "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is given by (y is positive vertically upwards) "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\omega = \dfrac{\sqrt{ag}}{\sqrt{b}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t="}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{\sqrt{z}\pi}{6\sqrt{g}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" respectevly. Find the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a+b+z"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Check your Calibre","marks":[{"attrs":{"href":"","target":"_blank"},"type":"link"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"HERE a and b are positive coprime integers which are square free"}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large{y^{''} = -\omega^2 y =  -\omega^2 [sin\omega t + \sqrt{3} cos\omega t]}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find max magnitude of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y^{''}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and equate it to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"g"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large{y^{''}_{max} = \omega^2 \sqrt{1 + 3} = 2 \omega^2 = g \\ \boxed{\omega_{min} = \frac{\sqrt{g}}{\sqrt{2}}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The block can only leave the plank traveling downward.  Set "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"y^{''}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" equal to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-g"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and find the associated time."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\large{-g =  -\frac{g}{2} [sin \, \omega t_{leave} + \sqrt{3} cos \, \omega t_{leave}] \\ 
sin\,\omega  t_{leave} + \sqrt{3} cos\,\omega  t_{leave} = 2 \\ 
\implies \omega  t_{leave} = \frac{\pi}{6}} = \frac{\sqrt{g}}{\sqrt{2}}  t_{leave} \\
 \boxed{\large{t_{leave} = \frac{\sqrt{2} \pi}{6 \sqrt{g}}}} "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
